And he bought fine linen, and took him down, and wrapped him in the linen, and laid him in a sepulchre which was hewn out of a rock, and rolled a stone unto the door of the sepulchre.
And laid it in his own new tomb, which he had hewn out in the rock: and he rolled a great stone to the door of the sepulchre, and departed.

verses.text: And that day was the preparation, and the sabbath drew on.

similars.text: And now when the even was come, because it was the preparation, that is, the day before the sabbath,
And they returned, and prepared spices and ointments; and rested the sabbath day according to the commandment.
Remember the sabbath day, to keep it holy.
Remember the sabbath day, to keep it holy.

And remember that thou wast a servant in the land of Egypt, and that the Lord thy God brought thee out thence through a mighty hand and by a stretched out arm: therefore the Lord thy God commanded thee to keep the sabbath day.
Keep the sabbath day to sanctify it, as the Lord thy God hath commanded thee.
And it was the sabbath day when Jesus made the clay, and opened his eyes.

verses.text: And the women also, which came with him from Galilee, followed after, and beheld the sepulchre, and how his body was laid.

similars.text: (Who also, when he was in Galilee, followed him, and ministered unto him;) and many other women which came up with him unto Jerusalem.
And his disciples came, and took up the body, and buried it, and went and told Jesus.
And certain of them which were with us went to the sepulchre, and found it even so as the women had said: but him they saw not.
And Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses beheld where he was laid.

verses.text: And they returned, and prepared spices and ointments; and rested the sabbath day according to the commandment.
